Reviews.Title: “Great location in alexander platz!”
Reviews.Author: olasBH
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, good rooms, excellent breakfast and good wifi service! Its a little difficult to find the hotel by the adress - the hotel is in the alexander avenue, in front of the square! The location is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Antianja
Reviews.Content: We were traveling in a group of four, and got two different rooms, one on the 3rd floor facing the street (small, noisy and too warm) and the other on 6th floor facing the backyard (big, quiet and cool), e.g. you should ask for a room facing the backyard. But both of the rooms were tidy and clean, and even the smallest room offered more than enough space for two persons included two big suitcases. The breakfast is splendid and offers everything you need, bread, cereal, fruit, croissants, coffee, eggs, smoothies(!)++ The breakfast room (which is also the lobby) is small and the number of tables limited, so you should arrive early (or late) - otherwise you might have to wait a few minutes to get a table. At night, the entrance is closed, but the reception is open 24h, and we had no problem getting in when coming back to the hotel in the middle of the night. All together, a nice hotel with excellent location - and well worth the €30/person/night incl. breakfast that we payed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good value”
Reviews.Author: KirstenMarieEbbesen
Reviews.Content: Nice, comfy hotel. Not in the complete "center" of Berlin, but a mere walking distance away. Furthermore, great connections with public transportation at any time of the day. Breakfast was very good - better than expected. Be sure to eat early (before 9) if you don´t want to stand in line. Staff very friendly and good at English. Hotel nice and clean. All in all good value for money on a lot of parameters. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Top spot”
Reviews.Author: Goran B
Reviews.Content: hello. I stayed 3 nights in this hotel. It was amazing. The location is the best. right close to the Alexander square where you have it all. Getting around is easy by using taxi or U.or S. Bahn. The hotel is very clean and the rooms have a great modern design. Rather small bathroom but still good enough. Morning breakfast is delicious and great variety of food. The staff is rather polite and well educated. all in all, I think this is best you can get for short stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: astrolabos Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, just a breath away from Alexanderplatz. Very quiet, friendly stuff, everything was fine!

Reviews.Title: “Good city center option”
Reviews.Author: samuul
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the All Season at Alexanderplatz. Arrived late but that was not a problem, ok room facing the street which meant some noise from passing trams, but this was no problem. Bed was good and the room was nice and clean. Free Wifi was good (but quite slow)and the breakfast had most of the things you need. The hotel is very close to both the train and the trams making it a very good place to travel around Berlin from. This is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Five out of Five!!”
Reviews.Author: Amy L
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, perfect location with walking distance to shops, restaurants and main attractions. Very nice staff, breakfast outstanding! nice rooms, would definitely stay again. Was a bit loud with the trams outside, but not enough to bother us really.

Reviews.Title: “Bad internet”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was a good hotel, room was good and the service was OK what was not so good was internet, because if you market internet and Wifi so hard then the speed should be ok, now the speed was like what i did have home 10 years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Option”
Reviews.Author: OmarCuriel
Reviews.Content: Hi I just want to say that if you plan to visit Berlin, you must stay at this place, very clean, very friendly staff, always helpful, and really well located... its one of the best options to stay in Berlin, Ive been there on January 2012 and I definitely will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Vegasking
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights on a business trip, pretty quiet on one side and a litlle noisy on the orther due to the trams. Location is superb close to both Alexanderplatz U & S Bahn. Decent if a little restrained buffet breakfast, but all in all would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarceloSales
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good one. The rooms are large and have a lot of space for luggage. Despite the red carpet that is a bit strange taste, all the things are fine. The location is very good, very close to alexanderplatz, with a lot of commerce and restaurants around. From there there's a open road for berlin. You will have a very good sleep and the staff is very kind. The breakfast is excellent, with a lot of options to fulfill your hungry. there is no mistake, you will have a remember stay. And least, but no the least, Berlin is amazing. Give just 10 years ahead and the city will be the brain (and the heart) of europe.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: liambr
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend this hotel for the more cost concious traveller. For the price, this hotel is very good. Rooms are a bit basic, but they were clean, comfortable and had everything you would expect of a modern hotel room. The staff were friendly, helpful and spoke very good English. Breakfast was quite good with lots of options and convenient times. Location was excellent for visiting most central sites, just a minute walk away from the Alexanderplatz U-Bahn station.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay for conference”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean room, excellent location. Shower and details in the room felt cheap. The door handle to the bathroom was loose and fell off. The bed was too hard, but I guess that´s a matter of taste. Otherwise a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, delicious breakfast buffet, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Antwerpgirl_10
Reviews.Content: The location is really super for exploring Berlin. We had a compact room which provided us with all the necessities. The breakfast buffet was delicious, with fresh fruits, yoghurts and a selection of bread with ham, cheese, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Yukky hotel”
Reviews.Author: gregsgirl23 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this on the Accor website, the pictures are decieving. It's basically a dump here. The only good thing is the location, right near the Alexandarplatz. Thankfully we arrived late at night and only had to stay one night in this horrible hotel. The room was mostly clean but stains on the carpet, the bathroom was so tiny and the hallways were just dingy and revolting. The staff weren't very friendly and the breakfast was adequate but not great. Wouldn't recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy this hotel and your location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is great, near the public transportation, magazines, christmas market. Was very nice stay in the All Seasons. The breakfast was good, the staff is adorable and the silence in the city center was wonderfull. I recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Smart clean hotel, well located, very good price”
Reviews.Author: IsabelVM
Reviews.Content: The hotel has basic but modern facilities, rooms are nice and clean and the breakfast is extremely generous. The staff is polite and very professional. Very good location, direct transportation from Tegel Airport to Alexanderplatz and both U-Bahn and S-Bahn Stations are 300 m from the Hotel. The only difficulty was to find the it since the street was recently renamed. The location is such that you can easely walk to the Inselmuseums, Brandenbourg Gate and Reishtag so the 3 day transport ticket might not be necessary, you just have to buy return tickets to the other sights. Very good bet!

Reviews.Title: “A good value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Berlin and we chose the Hotel on the internet. It turned out to be an excellent choice, the room was a decent size, beds comfortable and very clean. We were warmly welcomed and given a bag containing 2 bottles of water and maps which we thought was a nice gesture. Breakfasts were all that we needed, choice of 4 cereals, selection of cold meats, cheeses, boiled eggs, selection of breads, croissants, and a large bowl of fresh fruit salad which was fresh fruit, not out of a tin. The Hotel was in a good position in Alexander Platz, which was within walking distance of many major sites. Within 5 mins walk we had access to main line trains, underground, trams, and buses. We plan to go again next year and will stay at the same Hotel. Just one point to note, we went middle of November, the Christmas markets were just being assembled , next year we will go at the beginning of December.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: City centre hotel so expect some noise. Great base for all means of transport. Good breakfast. Transport is cheap and easy. Don't buy any of the 3 day passes as you will struggle to get your monies worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, clean hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Peter D
Reviews.Content: For a good value city centre hotel with a great location for sight-seeing in Berlin there must be few to compare. The connections from Alexanderplatz are ideal and the U-bahn, S-bahn, trams and buses (including the Tegel airport bus) are only a stone's throw away. The hotel is clean and tidy and the rooms are a fair size. The breakfast was very good with a broad range of choice and high quality. The staff were helpful and willing to accommodate our needs. The useful Wi-Fi Internet facility (which is free of charge) is also of benefit. In conclusion, for the price the hotel is highly recommended in all respects.

Reviews.Title: “Night at Alexanderplatz All Seasons Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Most staff were very helpful and polite. The room was fine though I have stayed in better All Season Hotels. The entrance location was not in such a salubrious street. The bathroom was enormous however the shower was not curtained off from the bathroom so as a result the floor of the entire bathroom gets wet after a shower. Also, the outlook of our room was a neighbouring apartment/business block and not that pleasant. Wifi service was free and good. Also, breakfast was very good and plentiful and in a pleasant room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A budget hotel, but suprisingly good value. Staff is very friendly, breakfast included, with a nice smoothie and fresh fruit salad. Not a very cosy location, but quite close to the Museumsinsel. I need to fill this box, the lower limit is 200 characters.

Reviews.Title: “our stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very easy to get to with transport system and was very central to the sights of the city. The rooms were clean and while there was no coffee making facilities in the room there were downstairs at reception. The breakfast was excellent, probably the best we had on the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,value for money”
Reviews.Author: lisaselencer Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to Alexanderplatz.The location is great.It is quite easy to reach everywhere by metro.Even you can go to Berlin TV tower on foot.The room fare includes the breakfast and free Wifi in the room.The room is very clean,hotel staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice place, close to museum and bundestag, room very clean and very good breakfast. A little bit noise due to the disco club in front of the hotel... hotel doors close early in the evening (around 9 p.m. to 9 a.m.) and you have to ring to enter. A key for each room...it's better for each person!

Reviews.Title: “Value for price”
Reviews.Author: Nasse_9
Reviews.Content: Spend a little city holiday with my better half in Berlin and decided to stay in All Seasons Berlin Alexanderplatz. According TripAdvisor picture, the hotel seemed quite new and cosy, which it really was. I usually prefer hostels, but this time decided to put a little more money in, and upgrade to a hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff, good basic breakfast, clean rooms (which were kept clean daily) and all the furniture etc in very good condition. I would recommend this to any one since this hotel is a good value for money! Keep in mind that the rooms on the side of the street might not be as quiet as the one we got on the backside.

Reviews.Title: “Airconditioning disabled - forget it”
Reviews.Author: trevmar
Reviews.Content: This is one of the increasing number of Hotels where management has decided that the room cooling can only be switched on after considerable argument. There are other niggling problems - stairs between the street and check-in counter, only one elevator to the rooms. But the airconditioning is a show-stopper (see the other reviews here). Next time I will choose the ETAP instead - it's cheaper, and just around the corner...

Reviews.Title: “If  Ikea Did low cost Hotels, They Might Be Like This!”
Reviews.Author: OleDunk
Reviews.Content: It's certainly different. Think Holiday Inn Express goes even more functional, with stencilled walls and bright fittings, all designed to make the basic design look "cool".  Located in a busy student area. Smallest room I have stayed in since tight budget travel in my teens, so small not even a desk or table in the room,  but a kind of hospital bed trolley.  To be fair, I stayed here as Berlin hotels very busy due to a trade fair and the target market of this hotel is probably not normally me! Clean, comfortable bed, air con, free WiFi (poor reception in my room), decent shower, free breakfast and coffee and very  pleasant welcoming and helpful reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: ashaham
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 days in Berlin. During my visit I stayed at this 3 star hotel. didn't expect mush, after all just a 3 stars... but the location is great, the staff is very helpful, the rooms are very clean and convenient, and the breakfast is exceptionally good. This is great value for your money. Very recommended!! the only downside is the noise from the street. ask for high floor, back side room, or sleep with the windows close.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bboogg
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms, quite large, nice furnished, and clean. We have been there in December-January, shortly after the hotel opened. Breakfast is nice. There no restaurant or bar, but there are several in the area. There are sandwiches available at the reception desk. I have no idea if there is Internet connection: we have been there for a short holiday :) The location is good: even if not central, the subway stop is 30 meters from the hotel entrance, and in some 10-15 minutes one can be anywhere in the touristic city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mica02
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit in Berlin and i was looking for a central located hotel, and i found this one. For someone who travels a lot, i stayed in many hotels and this one is probably one of the more comfortable and pleasant stays i had in a hotel. I had a single room on the 7th floor and it was specious, the bed was comfortable, there were always hot water and my room was facing the parking lot so there was peace and quiet. The hotel itself is located 5 mins walk from Alexanderplatz Ubhan, and it is easy to find. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. All together ir was a great stay and i will surley be back here next time i am in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “good price and location”
Reviews.Author: angelaclaudiaC
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights at this hotel. The room was ok. The bathroom too small , hairdryes wasn't good. Stairs when you arrive to reach the reception. No luggage storage and the recepcionist told me to put my luggage in the reception i mean outside the reception desk what i really think that was not a safe place to put it. In addition the recepcionists weren't very helpfull.Asked how to go to the airport and she gave me the wrong direction i was lucky because the other recepcionist told me to go to Alexander station and take a direct train. The location was fine to visit all the places of interest, there were some stores and places to eat across the street at alexanderplatz. Free internet was a plus. In general was a good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Was great!”
Reviews.Author: Madartoll
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really in the center of Berlin. (metro, tram, to the Alexander platz trainstation there are trains from the Schönefeld airport in every hour) The room was nice with air cond., and a small, proper bathroom, plus TV. There was one public PC for the visitors at the reception. The breakfast was continental,( eat what you like). I would choose this place again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Geelongcatter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our recent stay at this hotel. It is very well located, well priced and the staff are very helpful and friendly. We had a good quiet room and the breakfast was very acceptable. The hotel is within walking distance of all of the main attractions andi shops. A very enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “little gem”
Reviews.Author: irishtourerIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find, it was very cheap with a great location. We got a 20 minute S bahn from Schoenfeld airport to alexanderplatz station and the hotel is 3 minutes walk from there very easy to find once you come out the right door!!! (the one at the end by McDonalds) turn left and straight. You are also only 1 minute for the U bahn station but we walked everywhere to experience the city, most of the famous things are about a 30 minutes walk but lots to see on the way. Food and drink: there are a few pubs with alot of out door seating just by the train station but we went to a pub area recommended by the receptionist at the hotel. It was 10/15 minutes walk or 1 stop I think on the S bahn, nice area with lots of pubs. The Kilkenny pub was good with friendly Irish staff and a good atmosphere for all ages it was also good for food, prices the same as Ireland (which is big enough) but that was the same all over. There is a nightclub across from the hotel we didnt go, we were there monday to friday so I dont know if there is any noise from it. The staff in the hotel were very nice and very helpful, we didnt need to go to a tourist office because the receptionist marked out everything worth seeing for us!! A walking tour of the city is worth doing, some of which are free. They have a free computer in the reception area and they printed out our boarding cards for free. The pictures on their website are exactly as it is, we booked a family room for the 3 of us just for the extra space - it cost nothing extra. The room was clean and quiet. For E93 each for 4 nights plus breakfast ( continental) which was lovely. It was excellent value you definitely got more than you paid for. Shopping in the area: there is a big shopping centre 2 minutes from alexanderplatz station and some shops around the station are well worth a look. ( shops not open Good Friday)

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, but noisy environment”
Reviews.Author: dellaert
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious, breakfast was OK and the location very convenient. The rooms at the street side are very noisy, with lots of building activities going on, a noisy night club and a continuous flow of trams.

Reviews.Title: “Basic - great location.”
Reviews.Author: Navman_Tom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about the location - the rooms are very basic and the hotel doesn't look very appealing from the outside. But if does have some of the basics right..... - it was clean / good room cleaning - it was in a good location - excellent breakfast - tourist information If you are looking for a clean budget hotel in a good location this is a great choice - it does have a back packer hostel feel to it, but otherwise is a good roof over your head.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Nightclub Opposite.”
Reviews.Author: EalingTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Berlin marathon weekend and all the hotels were full, we paid 140 Euro and were expecting something relatively nice. It was called the Arena Hotel and has just changed its name. Alexanderplatz is undergoing a lot of renovation and looked a mess. I would not stay in this area again. The hotel is very basic, more like a 2 star, however the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The problem was a nightclub that was opposite, we left at 8am and the music was still on. All night we could hear people outside the club laughing and singing. Great if you want to party, terrible if you want to sleep. Very noisy, very basic, not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money accompanied by great location”
Reviews.Author: amos_bnt
Reviews.Content: The All Seasons hotel (formerly Arena ) in Alexanderplatz has a small crew that does his best to keep the visitor satisfied. The rooms are of medium size and they are quite quiet due to noise blocking windows. Breakfeast is very good and can keep one "running" for a long time. The free Wi-Fi requires a password, but it still useful to get internet access. The location of the hotel near S/U Bahn stations makes it an ideal place for starting many trips. Shopping is also easy with Alexa and Galeria Kaufhof nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good,clean,quiet,great location.”
Reviews.Author: UkDodge
Reviews.Content: As a hotel for B&B this is ideal.The breakfast is substantial and the staff were extremely helpful with advice for restaurants etc. As a small group we were not looking for the service and ambience expected of the more grand hotels,but this hotel provided all the other requirements. Would strongly suggest if you wanted a value for money establishment,close to all the sites....this is it. NOTE this hotel was previously called Arena. I mention this as we booked it under this name and the change of name caused a problem with our taxi service from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Mikkaau
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good, inexpensive and well located hotel in Berlin, look no further than the Arena. An early morning flight meant an early arrival at the hotel and they were happy to look after my luggage for the day while I was out sightseeing. The location is excellent, being right at Alexanderplatz which offers all forms of transport by which you can easily criss cross the city. (Buying a Berlin Welcome card is a great idea, giving unlimited transport access and discounts for many attractions, tours and cafes throughout this fantastic city) You can also pick up the Berlin round city bus tour just around the corner in Alexanderstrasse A pleasant young man at reception was particularly helpful with tourist information and the breakfast at 5.50 euros is good value. My room was an ample size, clean and with a clean modern bathroom. Only drawback was the location of my room at the front of the hotel overlooking the road and tramtracks. Quite noisy, but I was so tired from my days out sightseeing that it wasn't too much of a problem. Overall, a good choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great combination of Price & location”
Reviews.Author: pkbalrothery
Reviews.Content: great location just off alexanderplatz, probably one of the best locations to stay in Berlin. Rooms were quite big ( plenty of room for 2 baby cots that were provided), clean, and shower is great. Staff friendly. No tea/coffee facilities in the room which was a bit of a shame - but if you're looking for an affordable hotel in a great location, this is where to go!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a great location at a very good price.”
Reviews.Author: LI-traveler59
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights this February (2010) at this hotel and I was quite pleased. As advertised it was clean, efficient, well managed and close to all attractions. This was my daughters first time staying in a German-style hotel, at 16 she has been spoiled staying at American-style hotels like Hilton’s and Marriott’s, with big rooms, flat screen TV’s with dozens of channels, big lobbies with a restaurant, bar, pool, exercise room, etc… However she quickly adapted and assimilated into what the hotel had to offer. She especially liked the breakfast. As for myself, when I travel to Europe I purposely seek out hotels such as this one. I like the cleanliness, the small rooms and the personal attention you get as I got at this hotel and the price for the value was just right. The location was great, one block off Alexanderplatz with access to rail lines, trolleys, taxies and great shops and malls with many different types restaurants within a two to three block radius. I felt safe and secure at this hotel especially traveling with my teenage daughter. I would recommend this hotel to others and I hope to return to Berlin shortly and I would very much consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, clean comfy room, superb location”
Reviews.Author: NormandieUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect - cheap, clean, nice room and friendly staff. I gat a rate of £25ppn through lastmin.com and it was perfect for our weekend trip. Location is very handy, especially for the nightlife in east Berlin, and the tube takes you to where you want to go really quickly.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: MargaretLiverpool
Reviews.Content: We arrived late, after finding that there were no trains from Schoenfeld. We were told they were all "kaput" The reception staff were very welcoming and friendly and we were pleasantly surprised at our rooms, as the hotel doesn't look much from the outside. The rooms were very clean and warm with very comfortable beds, and the bathroom, whilst not huge, was all we could have wanted and was immaculate. Breakfast the next morning was enough to set us up until mid afternoon, as there were cereals, fruit, youghurts, various eggs, cheeses, meats and rolls. The location was perfect, as we only had to cross the main road to get to the Alexanderplatz Christmas market.(If you are looking for a good night try the Party House in the market?) It is also, obviously, near to the Alexanderplatz train station, which, if the trains are ok, is where you get the train fo the airport.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Fozgirl
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in Hotel Arena, and we had the best time. A GOOD value for your money !!!!! First of all, the hotel is clean! the people in the reception were very nice to us. Although the view from the room was just another building in repairing, we like our room very much. And anyway, it's not like we came to Berlin to sin in the room and watch the city from the window... so it didn't mattered to us. The breakfast was good, just what we needed. don't expect too much of it, very standard, but good!! I personally recommend having the hotel's breakfast. The location of the hotel also is very good! 3 min walk from the TV station and to the train station (BTW - they have an express train from the airport that stops in Alexanderplatz). Next to the TV station they have Starbucks, but if you'll walk 3 more min to the city center you could have a GREAT cup of coffee in Balzac Coffee with a good banana bread cake (or any other cake :) ). By foot, from the hotel to brandenburg gate, it will take you about 40-50 min, but it's a nice walk :) In calculation, I recommend this hotel, and know for a fact that I will take this one the naxt time i'll be in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap - clean and lovely”
Reviews.Author: TzeniAns
Reviews.Content: Really large rooms for a 3 star, fun decoration, flat tv screen, the air condition worked just fine (it was february so it HAD to work), really tasty breakfast, next to alexa and the alexanderplatz stations, friendly stuff offered hot chocolate when we arrived at midnight. Under 30 but picky people should stay there

Reviews.Title: “Nightclub Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: skidub
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is quite good, just off Alexanderplatz, but that is about the only plus about it. We stayed on a Thursday and Friday, the first night was ok the rooms are clean but basic with no hairdryer or glasses in the bathroom. Friday night however was a disaster. The nightclub directly across the street had us awake until 5am, and we had to be up at 7am!!! This hotel certainly at weekends, cannot provide you with the most basic facility of all, namely a decent nights sleep.

HotelInfo.Name: All Seasons Berlin Alexanderplatz
HotelInfo.Address: Bernhard-Weiss-Strasse 8 | ehem. Otto-Braun-Straße 25, 10178 Berlin, Germany
